title: [BUG] readthedocs does not automatically embed a link when citing estimator by name
body:
**Describe the bug**
<!--
-->

It was discovered that when adding a "See Also" section in the docstring, readthedoc does not always render the text as link when an estimator is mentioned by name. Example: 

BATS
https://www.sktime.org/en/v0.7.0/api_reference/modules/auto_generated/sktime.forecasting.bats.BATS.html
STLForecaster
https://www.sktime.org/en/stable/api_reference/auto_generated/sktime.forecasting.trend.STLForecaster.html?highlight=STL

SARIMAX
https://www.sktime.org/en/stable/api_reference/auto_generated/sktime.forecasting.sarimax.SARIMAX.html?highlight=SARIMAX

However, it works in this case
ARIMA
https://www.sktime.org/en/stable/api_reference/auto_generated/sktime.forecasting.arima.ARIMA.html?highlight=ARIMA

**To Reproduce**
<!--
Add a Minimal, Complete, and Verifiable example (for more details, see e.g. https://stackoverflow.com/help/mcve

If the code is too long, feel free to put it in a public gist and link it in the issue: https://gist.github.com
-->

```python
<"""
    See Also
    --------
    ARIMA
    AutoARIMA
    StatsForecastAutoARIMA

    References
    ----------
    .. [1] Hyndman, Rob J., and George Athanasopoulos. Forecasting: principles
    and practice. OTexts, 2014.
""">
```

**Expected behavior**
<!--
A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen.
-->
ARIMA, AutoARIMA, and StatsForecastAutoARIMA will be rendered as plain text after readthedoc processes them

**Additional context**
<!--
Add any other context about the problem here.
-->

**Versions**
<details>

<!--
Please run the following code snippet and paste the output here:
 
from sktime import show_versions; show_versions()
-->

System:
    python: 3.8.12 (default, Oct 12 2021, 03:01:40) [MSC v.1916 64 bit (AMD64)]
executable: C:\Users\trana\.conda\envs\sktime-dev\python.exe
   machine: Windows-10-10.0.22000-SP0

Python dependencies:
          pip: 21.2.2
   setuptools: 58.0.4
      sklearn: 1.0.1
       sktime: 0.11.0
  statsmodels: 0.13.2
        numpy: 1.21.4
        scipy: 1.7.3
       pandas: 1.3.4
   matplotlib: 3.5.0
       joblib: 1.1.0
        numba: 0.55.1
     pmdarima: None
      tsfresh: None

<!-- Thanks for contributing! -->
